name: boardlab
description: Vendor-independent board development for Visual Studio Code, powered by Arduino CLI.
author: dankeboy36

scripts.format: npm run format:js && npm run format:ino
scripts.lint: npm run lint:js && npm run lint:md
scripts.prepackage: npm run bundle && npm run download:builtins:verify
scripts.test:ci: npm --workspaces --if-present --fail-fast run test:ci && npm --workspaces --if-present --fail-fast run test:e2e && npm test && npm run test:vsix

commands.title: Add Additional Package Index URL to Arduino CLI config
Tail Latest Monitor Bridge Trace Log
Sync Board Settings: Sketch → Active Profile
Sync Board Settings: Active Profile → Sketch

boardlab.monitor.lineEnding.markdownDescription: Line ending appended to messages sent from the Monitor and Plotter inputs.

boardlab.monitor.fontSize.markdownDescription: Controls the font size in pixels of the Monitor terminal.

boardlab.monitor.cursorStyle.markdownDescription: Controls the style of Monitor terminal cursor when the terminal is focused.

boardlab.monitor.cursorInactiveStyle.markdownDescription: Controls the style of Monitor terminal cursor when the terminal is not focused.

boardlab.monitor.cursorBlink.markdownDescription: Controls whether the Monitor terminal cursor blinks.

boardlab.monitor.scrollback.markdownDescription: Controls the maximum number of lines the Monitor terminal keeps in its buffer. We pre-allocate memory based on this value in order to ensure a smooth experience. As such, as the value increases, so will the amount of memory.

boardlab.monitor.bridgePort.markdownDescription: Preferred TCP port for the BoardLab monitor bridge server used to connect Visual Studio Code instances. BoardLab will restart an existing BoardLab bridge on this port when needed. If a non-BoardLab process uses this port, monitor startup fails and the error is shown.

boardlab.monitor.bridgeHeartbeatInterval.markdownDescription: Interval in milliseconds for the extension to ping the monitor bridge. Set to 0 to disable heartbeats and stale attachment pruning.

boardlab.monitor.bridgeHeartbeatTimeoutM.markdownDescription: Time in milliseconds after the last heartbeat before the monitor bridge prunes an attachment. Set to 0 to disable heartbeats and stale attachment pruning.

boardlab.monitor.bridgeLogHeartbeat.markdownDescription: Log monitor bridge heartbeat pings. Enable for debugging only.

boardlab.cli.daemonDebug.markdownDescription: Start the Arduino CLI daemon with the `--debug` flag. Changing this setting requires reloading the window.

boardlab.cli.configPath.markdownDescription: Absolute path to the Arduino CLI configuration file used by BoardLab. Leave empty to auto-detect.

boardlab.sketch.inoBlueprint.markdownDescription: Absolute filesystem path to the default `.ino` blueprint file. If specified, the content of the blueprint file will be used for every new sketch created by BoardLab. The sketches will be generated with the default Arduino content if not specified. Unaccessible blueprint files are ignored.

boardlab.compile.verbose.markdownDescription: True for verbose compile output. False by default

boardlab.compile.warnings.markdownDescription: Tells gcc which warning level to use. It's 'None' by default

boardlab.upload.verbose.markdownDescription: True for verbose upload output. False by default.

boardlab.hooks.preCompileTasks.markdownDescription: Task labels to run before compile tasks (`compile`, `compile-with-debug-symbols`, `export-binary`). Tasks run in order. Non-zero exit code blocks the compile task. Defaults to `BoardLab: Validate Sketch Profile`.

boardlab.hooks.postCompileTasks.markdownDescription: Task labels to run after compile tasks (`compile`, `compile-with-debug-symbols`, `export-binary`). Tasks run in order. Failures are reported but do not change compile result.

boardlab.hooks.preUploadTasks.markdownDescription: Task labels to run before upload tasks (`upload`, `upload-using-programmer`, `burn-bootloader`). Tasks run in order. Non-zero exit code blocks the upload task.

boardlab.hooks.postUploadTasks.markdownDescription: Task labels to run after upload tasks (`upload`, `upload-using-programmer`, `burn-bootloader`). Tasks run in order. Failures are reported but do not change upload result.

command.description: The BoardLab command to execute. Supported commands are 'compile', 'compile-with-debug-symbols', 'upload', 'upload-using-programmer', 'burn-bootloader', 'export-binary', 'archive-sketch', 'get-board-info', and 'validate-sketch-profile'.

sketchPath.description: The path to the sketch to compile.

fqbn.description: Fully Qualified Board Name (FQBN) for the compilation and upload or to disambiguate if more than one platform provides the pluggable monitor for a given port protocol. For example, 'arduino:avr:uno'.

port.description: TODO! The qualified name of the port. The port protocol and the port address separated by a colon (`:`). The address can consists of the host and port separated by an additional colon. For example, 'serial:/dev/cu.usbmodem14201' or 'teensy:/usb:14300000'

programmer.description: The technical ID of the programmer to use

viewsWelcome.contents:
No sketches were detected in this workspace.
[Create Sketch](command:boardlab.openNewSketchWizard)

Open an existing sketch by adding it to this workspace.
[Open Sketch](command:boardlab.openSketch)

Clone a sketch into this workspace. The original sketch remains unchanged in its source location.
[Clone Sketch](command:boardlab.cloneSketch)

To learn more about how sketches are structured, [read the documentation](https://arduino.github.io/arduino-cli/latest/sketch-specification).
